summary: Pyongyang is the capital of North Korea, located near the Taedong River. With a population of over 3 million, it's the country's largest city. Known as the "Capital of the Revolution," it has been an important city in Korean history, serving as the capital of ancient kingdoms. After the Korean War, it was rebuilt with Soviet help. Today, Pyongyang is North Korea's political, industrial, and transport hub, dominated by the ruling Workers' Party of Korea.
title: Pyongyang
